channel.title: Guide on Bring Your Own Keys Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Guide on Bring Your Own Keys Blog

item.title: Add your wallets
item.description: Add your wallet by ENS name, or Ethereum EVM address. The Wallet Name is used for display purposes only. The address is never stored on a centralized server. It stays in your browser’s localStorage, and gets sent to the data providers (e.g., Alchemy, Etherscan) when we request any blockchain data for the first time.

item.title: Etherscan keys
item.description: This guide show you how to find/obtain your Etherscan API private keys, and provide it securely. Funds are SAFU. The concept Etherscan refers generally to the various chain explorer APIs across EVM L1s as well as L2s. Etherscan refers to Ethereum Mainnet. PolygonScan refers to Polygon POS chain. Optimistic-Etherscan refers to Optimism. Arbiscan refers to Arbitrum One.

item.title: Alchemy
item.description: This guide will show you how to obtain/find your Alchemy private API key and provide it securely. Funds are SAFU.

item.title: Known Chains
item.description: üóùÔ∏è BYOK App is multi-chain by construction The following EVM chains are supported: - Ethereum - Polygon POS - Optimism - Arbitrum One.
